summary: This is an email chain from August 16, 2019, regarding the preparation and service of subpoenas for financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoenas target Chase, UBS Financial Services, MoneyGram, Western Union, and Experian. The correspondence involves a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and an FBI forensic accountant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The entire email chain is about preparing subpoenas to obtain her financial records from various institutions as part of an investigation.

events.title: Subpoenas Issued for Maxwell's Financial Records
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor requests the preparation of subpoenas to Chase, UBS, MoneyGram, Western Union, and Experian for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
FBI New York Field Office, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: On August 16, 2019, federal prosecutors were actively subpoenaing financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The targeted institutions were JP Morgan Chase, UBS Financial Services, MoneyGram, Western Union, and Experian.
The investigation involved coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI's New York Field Office.
The correspondence indicates a focus on tracing financial transactions and obtaining personal data (via Experian) related to Maxwell.
The document is a direct record of the investigative steps taken by law enforcement prior to Maxwell's arrest.
